channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: Fly tipping, 10th February
item.description:
This is another set of trash dumped on the foothpath near our house. These are taped bags so unsure of its contents. This is the 2nd time this has happened, oddly its the same looking trash bags, when I first reported a similar incident.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Perry Hall Road, Poverest, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Continued Flytupoin tipping attention needed, 10th February
item.description:
Further to ref: 8849897, 8730739, 8676867, and 8682206, the issue of constant fly tipping, with black rubbish bags and other rubbish being left out in the communal pathway, continues unresolved week after week. This latest instance occurred either on the night 09 Feb or very early (before 6:15am) in the morning of 10 Feb. Attention to this matter to stop it from happening continuously, week after week, is urgently needed.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Lucey Way, Bermondsey, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Holes in road, 10th February

item.description:

item.title: Cars parked in goods vehicle loading bay, 10th February
item.description:
Every time I try to park to load/unload goods, I find these bays are taken by drivers parking their cars. I politely asked one driver sat in his Vauxhall when he was going to move so I could unload, he showed me his disabled badge and said he wasn’t moving. Loading bays are specifically for loading/unloading only.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 72, Brockley Rise, Honor Oak, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Small drain leak on road, 10th February
item.description:
Drain leak on Buckingham Palace Road in yellow box junction leading into Victoria Bus Station/ Terminus Place. Been leaking since 0200hrs on 10/02/2026. Just a trickle of water moving down into Bus Station
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Terminus Place, Victoria, City of Westminster

item.title: Number 37 Plumstead common road., 10th February
item.description:
Residential wheelie bins left on the pavement AT ALL TIMES, constantly overflowing and not one of them is for recycling. Local GP Surgery just feet away. People struggle to walk past with kids or the elderly as most of the pavement is blocked by rubbish and there is only space for one person to walk through. The wheelie bins have a proper spot by the side of the building (Herbert Place SE18 ) not the front of it on Plumstead Common Road. Please and thank you.

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Plumstead Common Road, Plumstead
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Household rubbish dumped., 10th February
item.description:
Known residents of Wickham lane dumping rubbish on Bastion Road. Attracting vermin. Please can this be cleared as a priority. I am so frustrated. Every day it’s something new dumped.

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Bastion Road, Abbey Wood
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Large Bed Base dumped by post box, 10th February
item.description:
There is a large brown bed base on Wickham Lane near the post box. It was laying flat and blocking the pavement at one point.

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Wickham Lane, Plumstead
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Rubbish along the whole grass verge, 10th February
item.description:
I did report this under ref 8514492, which included a report about scattered papers. From the junction where Alsike meets Rushdene heading towards Maran Way and further, there is a build up of rubbish along the whole stretch of the grass verge along the railway track. It's a constant problem and needs regular monitoring. I can only send two pics, but I'd need to send about fifteen

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Alsike Road, West Heath, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet
